intro: Sphaerocoryne astiae, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, pentagonal flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light. Its flowers bloom continuously throughout the year under optimal conditions, making it a popular ornamental plant. Sphaerocoryne astiae has adapted to humid environments and requires consistent moisture and well-draining soil to flourish.
